intro: Coccothrinax camagueyana, commonly known as the Camagüey palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to Cuba and is characterized by its slender, unbranched trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by globose, red or orange fruits. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils. This palm is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and resilience to environmental stress.
